channel.title: Need help with my vps
channel.description:
I have just bought Softys VPS and im stuggling to get the server running on the remote ip VPS, ive switched over the server files, got java on there, got no-ip on there but still no luck, this is my first ever VPS so you can tell why im struggling. please don't flame me how easy it could be because i cant seem to fix it haha. If anyone could help could the contact me on skype and ill teamveiw to show my problem. I do feel stupid for asking because i see so many people say they are easy to use and set up, sorry i guess :palm:
Thanks!

item.title: Need help with my vps
item.dc:creator: @Coldmedicine Coldmedicine
item.description:
@Coldmedicine wrote:

[quote=“Project Territh, post:7, topic:549103”]Turn the firewall off on the vps always works for me, vps’s are auto portforwarded almost all of them.[/quote]The fuck?

Never put off your firewall…

Read full topic

item.description:

Turn the firewall off on the vps always works for me, vps’s are auto portforwarded almost all of them.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with my vps
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

khayam:

Oh i usually do it myself takes a minute

Yeah, you can do it yourself. Not hard, you’re right. But, the awesome part about VPS companies is they will do it for you.

When I ordered my VPS, I wrote a note to them in the order asking to have port 43594 opened in the firewall and wherever else they may have needed to open it (some vps companies are different…).
So when I got on it all I had to do was put the server on it and start it.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with my vps
item.dc:creator: @khayam khayam
item.description:
@khayam wrote:

Oh i usually do it myself takes a minute

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with my vps
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

khayam:

with vps you have to manually allow port 43594 inbound and outbound in firewall rules, maybe thats the problem?

No you don’t.
Talk to the VPS host. They’ll do it for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with my vps
item.dc:creator: @khayam khayam
item.description:
@khayam wrote:

with vps you have to manually allow port 43594 inbound and outbound in firewall rules, maybe thats the problem?

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with my vps
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Yeah, 9/10 problems with a VPS are/will be solved by the VPS hosting company.

You need to ask them (NOT US) to make sure port 43594 is open for both inbound and outbound connections.
And you can probably ask them to open your windows firewall (if you are on windows and it is enabled).

The rest is cake.

Run No-IP (so it acts as a DNS).
Run your server.
Change the IP in the client to the No-IP if not already.
Jar the client
Distribute it
???
profit.

Read full topic
